column1: Rule 1: Modifiers containing both a carboxylic acid group (–COOH) and an amino group (–NH2) with an alkyl chain of 5 or fewer carbons tend to result in a high yield.
column2: Rule 7: Modifiers with a trifluoromethyl group (–CF3) tend to result in a low yield unless combined with groups that can donate electrons.
column3: Rule 9: Modifiers with a benzofuran group tend to result in a high yield.
column4: Rule 12: Modifiers with a formyl group (–CHO) tend to result in a low yield.
